page.title: 08LEISURE-PAST AND PRESENT
page.content: In the last {40 years} the leisure provision for teenagers in {CLYDEBANK} has fallen. In the{1930s}Clydebank had a very modern swimming pool but, through lack of modernisation, this is now deteriorating. In the same way,the number of local{cinemas}and{dance {halls}has dropped to zero. Young people in the town today have to travel outwith Clydebank to find such leisure activities. Although Clydebank provides more {sports clubs}and{youth clubs,}this does not help everybody as not everyone enjoys these activities. For older people there has been less change, but still a lack of improvement. The most commonly used facility is{Bowling}as it was in the 1930s.
